title: How to Make Muffins with Pancake Mix

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Prepare a muffin pan with nonstick spray or cupcake cases.

steps.headline: Add the pancake mix to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Pour in the milk, eggs and maple syrup. Mix to combine.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter to the muffin pan.
steps.description: Using a spoon or scoop, fill the muffin holes about two thirds each.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 13 to 15 minutes. The muffins are ready when a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the muffin pan, either by spraying with nonstick baking spray or lining with cases. A mini muffin pan is best for this mixture, allowing you to dip them in maple syrup for eating.

steps.headline: Sift the flour into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar, baking powder, baking soda and a pinch of salt. Whisk together.

steps.headline: In another bowl, add the buttermilk, egg and butter or oil.
Transfer the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Stir while adding it. Leave to sit for 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Using a spoon or scoop, place batter into the muffin pan holes.
steps.description: Fill about half way for each muffin.

steps.headline: Place the muffin pan in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 13 to 15 minutes. The muffins are done when a toothpick inserted into the muffin comes out clean.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Use warmed maple syrup to dip the muffins into.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients and kitchen equipment listed.
Grease your muffin pans with shortening or margarine, or use paper muffin cups.
Mix 3 cups pancake mix, 2 cups sugar and about 2 1/2 cups water together.
steps.description: You should end up with a thick consistency like pancake batter.

steps.headline: Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until center springs back to touch.

tyn: Paper muffin cups (if not greasing with shortening/margarine)
text: Simple pancake mix muffins Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Prepare a muffin pan with nonstick spray or cupcake cases. Add the pancake mix to a mixing bowl. Pour in the milk, eggs and maple syrup. Mix to combine. Transfer the batter to the muffin pan. Using a spoon or scoop, fill the muffin holes about two thirds each. Place in the oven. Bake for 13 to 15 minutes. The muffins are ready when a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Allow to cool. Serve fresh. Pancake mix from scratch muffins Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Prepare the muffin pan, either by spraying with nonstick baking spray or lining with cases. A mini muffin pan is best for this mixture, allowing you to dip them in maple syrup for eating. Sift the flour into a mixing bowl. Add the sugar, baking powder, baking soda and a pinch of salt. Whisk together. In another bowl, add the buttermilk, egg and butter or oil. Stir to combine. Transfer the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients. Stir while adding it. Leave to sit for 3 minutes. Using a spoon or scoop, place batter into the muffin pan holes. Fill about half way for each muffin. Place the muffin pan in the preheated oven. Bake for 13 to 15 minutes. The muffins are done when a toothpick inserted into the muffin comes out clean. Serve. Use warmed maple syrup to dip the muffins into. Sweet pancake mix muffins Gather the ingredients and kitchen equipment listed.  Grease your muffin pans with shortening or margarine, or use paper muffin cups.  Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Mix 3 cups pancake mix, 2 cups sugar and about 2 1/2 cups water together. You should end up with a thick consistency like pancake batter. Fill muffin cups half full.  Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until center springs back to touch.  Finished.
sentences: Simple pancake mix muffins Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Prepare a muffin pan with nonstick spray or cupcake cases.
Add the pancake mix to a mixing bowl.
Pour in the milk, eggs and maple syrup.
Mix to combine.
Transfer the batter to the muffin pan.
Using a spoon or scoop, fill the muffin holes about two thirds each.
Place in the oven.
Bake for 13 to 15 minutes.
The muffins are ready when a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Allow to cool.
Serve fresh.
Pancake mix from scratch muffins Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Prepare the muffin pan, either by spraying with nonstick baking spray or lining with cases.
A mini muffin pan is best for this mixture, allowing you to dip them in maple syrup for eating.
Sift the flour into a mixing bowl.
Add the sugar, baking powder, baking soda and a pinch of salt.
Whisk together.
In another bowl, add the buttermilk, egg and butter or oil.
Stir to combine.
Transfer the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients.
Stir while adding it.
Leave to sit for 3 minutes.
Using a spoon or scoop, place batter into the muffin pan holes.
Fill about half way for each muffin.
Place the muffin pan in the preheated oven.
Bake for 13 to 15 minutes.
The muffins are done when a toothpick inserted into the muffin comes out clean.
Serve.
Use warmed maple syrup to dip the muffins into.
Sweet pancake mix muffins Gather the ingredients and kitchen equipment listed.
Grease your muffin pans with shortening or margarine, or use paper muffin cups.
Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
Mix 3 cups pancake mix, 2 cups sugar and about 2 1/2 cups water together.
You should end up with a thick consistency like pancake batter.
Fill muffin cups half full.
Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until center springs back to touch.
Finished.
